summary: Completed testing of NEXUS Supply Chain OS Series B features. All 22 backend tests passed (100%). Fixed critical 'Maximum update depth exceeded' React error in DigitalTwin component. All Series B features working: DigitalTwin with physics simulation, DecisionTimeline with CSV/PDF export.
passed_tests: Backend: 'physics simulation' command returns world_model component
Backend: 'timeline audit' command returns timeline component
Frontend: Homepage loads with all 5 AI agent cards (DEMAND, PROCUREMENT, LOGISTICS, RISK, NEXUS)
Frontend: DigitalTwin component renders with physics controls (Physics, Cascade buttons)
Frontend: Physics simulation canvas renders (1804x891 pixels)
Frontend: Network Health Dashboard shows 5 metrics (Network Status, Avg Inventory, Active Demand, Critical Nodes, Sim Time)
Frontend: Node type legends display (Hub, Fulfillment Center, Port)
Frontend: World Model Physics explanation section renders
Frontend: DecisionTimeline component renders with 7 decision cards
Frontend: CSV export button works - downloads nexus-decisions-2026-01-28.csv
Frontend: Timeline stats bar shows 4 metrics (Total Decisions, Executed, Avg Confidence, Time Range)
Frontend: Playback controls work (play, skip, speed selector, agent filter)
Frontend: No 'Maximum update depth exceeded' errors after fix
seed_data_creation: None - using mocked data from backend
context_for_next_testing_agent: Fixed 'Maximum update depth exceeded' error in DigitalTwin.jsx by throttling physics simulation updates and using refs instead of state in animation loop. All Series B features tested: DigitalTwin with physics-based simulation, DecisionTimeline with CSV/PDF export. WebSocket warnings are expected (non-critical).
mocked_apis_note: MOCKED: AI Agent data, Physics simulation, Decision timeline data, Quantum optimization results, Blockchain transactions, Risk alerts - all simulated in backend server.py

bug_fix_applied.issue: Maximum update depth exceeded error in DigitalTwin component
bug_fix_applied.root_cause: simulatePhysics() was called on every animation frame, causing state updates (setDcs, setCascadeEffects, setSimTime) which triggered re-renders and restarted the animation loop
bug_fix_applied.fix: 1. Added throttling (100ms interval) for physics updates. 2. Used refs (dcsRef, cascadeEffectsRef) to read current values in animation loop without triggering re-renders. 3. Removed dcs, cascadeEffects, simTime from useEffect dependency array
